5. **TRAI Recommendations** - New framework for foreign SIM/eSIM in IoT devices

---

## Priority Alerts (Immediate Action Required)

### 1. DPDP Rules 2025 - CRITICAL
**Status:** Notified and partially in effect

The Digital Personal Data Protection Rules, 2025 were notified on **November 13, 2025**.

**Implementation Timeline:**
| Phase | Date | What Applies |
|-------|------|--------------|
| Stage 1 | Nov 13, 2025 | Data Protection Board instituted |
| Stage 2 | Nov 13, 2026 | Consent Manager registration |
| Stage 3 | May 13, 2027 | Full compliance obligations |

**Key Provisions:**
- Encryption and masking mandatory for all personal data
- Significant Data Fiduciaries (SDFs) must conduct annual DPIAs
- Penalties up to ₹250 Crore for non-compliance
- ₹200 Crore penalty for failure to disclose data breaches
- Section 43A of IT Act and SPDI Rules effectively superseded

**Sources:**
- [MeitY Official](https://www.meity.gov.in/documents/act-and-policies)
- [PIB Notification](https://www.pib.gov.in/PressReleasePage.aspx?PRID=2190655)
- [SCC Online Analysis](https://www.scconline.com/blog/post/2025/12/26/digital-personal-data-protection-rules-2025-key-highlights/)

---

### 2. IT Amendment Rules 2025 - Deepfakes & Content Removal
**Effective:** November 15, 2025

MeitY notified amendments to IT (Intermediary Guidelines) Rules 2021:

**Key Changes:**
- Only Joint Secretary rank or above can issue content removal orders
- Police directions only through DIG rank or above
- Mandatory labeling of AI-generated/synthetic content
- New due diligence for deepfakes and misinformation
- Enhanced intermediary oversight

**Source:** [KNN India](https://knnindia.co.in/news/newsdetails/sectors/others/meity-notifies-it-rules-2025-with-stronger-safeguards-for-content-removal-intermediary-oversight)

---

### 3. MeitY vs X/Grok - AI Content Moderation
**Status:** Active enforcement action

MeitY found X's response inadequate regarding Grok AI generating non-consensual intimate imagery. Demanding:
- Specific takedown details
- Prevention measures
- Compliance with intermediary liability framework

**Source:** [MediaNama](https://www.medianama.com/2026/01/223-meity-x-grok-undressing-images-takedown-info/)

## Key Case Law Updates

### Supreme Court
- **WhatsApp Privacy Case:** Users who haven't accepted 2021 privacy policy can continue using WhatsApp
- **Indian Kanoon (Right to be Forgotten):** SC stayed Madras HC order directing removal of judgment

### High Courts
- **Delhi HC:** Domain name registration regulation - ex ante approach raising speech/privacy concerns
- **Karnataka HC:** Recommending QR codes/APIs for bank guarantee fraud prevention

## Constitutional & Rights Watch

**IndConLaw Blog Analysis:**
- **IT Rules 2025 Draft:** Concerns about prior restraint and compelled speech (Article 19)
- **Sahyog Regime:** Analysis of content takedown architecture under Section 79(3)(b)

These analyses suggest ongoing constitutional tensions in India's digital regulation approach.
